IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Provide programs to encourage communication between schools and parents. Provide funds for educational programs based on community identified needs.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Provide programs to encourage communication between schools and parents. Provide funds for educational programs based on community identified needs.
IRS990.Desc: Provide educational materials and opportunities based on community identified needs.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each school Parent Teacher Organization works closely with its school through parent and teacher interaction. The needs of the school are determined by the parents and teachers. The approved funding is voted on by the organization. The parents and teachers are active participants in the use of the funds.

Taxpayer attempted to e-file nine times listing group subordinates but return was rejected each time because subordinates were unable to be cross referenced to IRS database. As a tenth attempt to e-file, taxpayer has removed group subordinates and has attached a list of the subordinates.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 6: Explanation of Classes of Members or Shareholder
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each parent of each student is a voting member of the board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7a: How Members or Shareholders Elect Governing Body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The officers of the board are elected by the parents of the students.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 7b: Describe Decisions of Governing Body Approval by Members or Shareholders
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The parents of the students vote on actions taken by the board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governing body consists of President, Vice-President, and Treasurer. The Treasurer works with the tax preparer to complete Form 990 and the applicable schedules. After completion, the Form 990 is presented to the President for their review and signature without a form meeting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PTO President reviews and signs conflict of interest policy and ensures Treasurer and any committees with authority to spend money are aware of and follow the policy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Copies of the board minutes are maintained at each school office and are available upon request. Governing documents are maintained at the school district office and are available upon request.
